summary: A podcast interview where Kevin Garnett shares a humorous and insightful story about a memorable interaction with Michael Jordan during his rookie year.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a black screen, followed by a scene of a basketball hoop with a net, set against a backdrop of a basketball court and a banner reading "1996 NBA PLAYOFFS." The scene transitions to a basketball game where a player in a white jersey with the number 23 is seen making a slam dunk, with the crowd in the background. The next scene shows a group of people sitting in a studio setting, engaged in a discussion, with a cityscape backdrop featuring a prominent building. The video then shifts to a man in a gray hoodie speaking into a microphone in a studio environment, with a window and a television screen in the background. The scene transitions back to a basketball game, showing players in action on the court, with the text "MJHISTORY" visible on the screen. The video continues with a player in a blue jersey with the name "GARNETT" and the number 21, followed by another basketball game scene where a player in a white jersey with the number 23 is dribbling the ball while being defended by a player in a blue jersey. The video concludes with a scene of a man in a gray hoodie speaking into a microphone in a studio environment, with a window and a television screen in the background.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a male speaker recapping an interview of Kevin Garnett on Showtime, specifically a story of trash-talking with Michael Jordan, while also announcing a breakdown of another Jordan-Garnett story. This is followed by an apology to viewers who haven't seen the original interview, and an overview of the video content to be included such as clips from the interviews and game footage. He is speaking in a conversational tone, expressing enthusiasm about the video content he has prepared. He encourages viewers to like the video and subscribe if they are new. Finally, he wraps up the introduction.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a basketball player in a white jersey with the number 23, standing on the court, surrounded by spectators. The scene transitions to a studio setting where four individuals are seated on a couch, engaged in a discussion. The studio is decorated with a cityscape backdrop, a coffee table with decorative items, and a lamp. events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with someone introducing a story about several individuals. They encourage viewers to share their thoughts about the story and video in the comments. The speaker switches to asking about a "best MJ story" before an excited "oh man" is heard. A person starts recalling a story, mentioning being in Chicago as a rookie. Then another person says they had played against someone three times, while another person named KG had never seen it. The speaker in the story continues, speaking about being "in the wave" and playing "decent" before getting to Chicago and being tired from a bad crash. They then explain that they were getting back to go and had around 70 people from the hood attending the game. The clip concludes with laughter.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a man speaking into a microphone, dressed in a white shirt and a dark vest, with a cityscape backdrop and a lamp beside him. The scene transitions to a basketball game, showing players in action on the court, including a player in a blue jersey with 'WOLVES' written on it. events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip opens with the sound of a basketball being dribbled, accompanied by an announcer's commentary, referencing Kevin Garnett and “Ferret buddies.”  A male speaker expresses that he's “on one,” describing lack of sleep and a hospital visit to see a partner in bed with a “big ass halo.” There's a shift as the speaker begins playing basketball, mentioning a game being played well by "JR". Another male speaker comments that he always stays quiet while playing, adding that if someone were to talk to him, he'd talk back, then claims he never talked crazy to them, then says "Right?" Another male voice is heard as he tells him, "yeah, you know better."  The first speaker responds to the first speaker in a friendly way. The first voice says "Easy Rider." Then the audio clip ends.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a basketball game where a player in a purple jersey, number 21, is seen dribbling the ball while being closely guarded by an opponent in a white jersey. The scene transitions to a studio setting where a man in a gray hoodie is speaking into a microphone, with a red chair and a window in the background. The video then cuts to another man in a white shirt and dark vest, speaking into a microphone in a different studio setting, with a lamp and plants in the background. The scene shifts back to the basketball game, showing a player in a white jersey, number 23, dribbling the ball while being guarded by a player in a purple jersey, number 21. The game continues with the player in the purple jersey, number 21, attempting to make a play while being closely guarded. The video then shows a close-up of the player in the purple jersey, number 21, with the scoreboard displaying '3rd Quarter,' 'T'Wolves 72,' 'Bulls 74,' and '1:32' remaining on the clock. The scene transitions back to the studio setting with the man in the white shirt and dark vest speaking into a microphone. The video concludes with a close-up of the man in the white shirt and dark vest, with the 'BASKETBALL' logo visible in the top left corner of the frame.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip starts with a male voice describing being ahead in a game, followed by a second male voice's short affirmation. The first male voice resumes, recounting how someone said, "keep going at his ass." A third male voice echoes, "just, just I'm on y'all". The first voice returns saying "I can't even explain it" continuing by encouraging someone to "keep killing that n-gga." A fourth male voice adds, "Serve him. He can't guard you," while the third male voice returns, saying "yo, straight up, you having a good game yo, keep going." Then the fourth male voice adds again, "He can't d-da-dat with you, he can't mess with you." The first male voice adds, "I was like," then states he was quiet. Another voice comes on saying, "it was on someone." Then a fifth male voice cuts off to say "yeah, you too" as the first voice states he was walking off. There is underlying upbeat music throughout the clip.

events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a male speaker stating, "Mike was literally right there", followed by "Nigga right here" and then continues with, "Mike could hear me, but I ain't really... I don't really give a fuck". The speaker then mimics someone by saying, "I don't care", in a more animated tone. Then the speaker explains how they were vibing together. A male speaker says, "Keep killing that nigga". The first speaker talks about telling someone to chill out, followed by a question, "Like what?", and then declares, "I feel it". There's audible laughter before the speaker describes a physical posture, "Hands on hips, legs locked". The speaker explains someone stared at him for 15 seconds, followed by someone looking back and forth. The speaker ends the clip asking, "You feel it?".

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a talk show setting where three men are seated on a couch, engaged in a lively discussion. events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a male speaker discussing a situation where he felt he was being observed while performing. He describes how he was "feeling it," and considered two possible responses: pretending he wasn't feeling it, or just embracing it. He decides to embrace it, saying "fuck that." A second male voice then provides encouragement, saying "Okay, keep it up." The first speaker continues, describing how someone, presumably JR, tried to get him to stop, but he ignored it. He concludes by explaining that he doubled back and was about to say something, but abruptly cuts off. Throughout the speech, music is heard, which sounds like a hip-hop style track, and the music and speech both give off a casual and comedic vibe.

events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with two male speakers discussing a basketball game, mentioning Kevin Garnett, Scottie, and their scoring performance. One speaker describes Garnett's performance as "having a great game on Scottie."  A short breath sound follows, then the first speaker continues, stating that Garnett "didn't understand that we don't talk to Mike like that." A second speaker chimes in with "no, you don't gas him up." There are background sounds throughout, including a steady, faint hum.

events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with an excited male voice stating "finally" followed by what sounds like a physical impact. Immediately, the speaker exclaims that something "got bad quick". He narrates a scenario of being on a rim, returning to defense on the bench, with heavy breathing sounds interspersed. Apologizing, he tells someone "my bad" and expresses regret. A second male voice responds in a dismissive tone with a curse word, followed by laughter. The first voice then continues, describing a situation with an attitude, saying "next thing you know we over there like this", making a sound resembling a soft slap. A third male voice interjects with "okay, Kenny". Overall, the audio suggests an informal conversation between multiple individuals, possibly in a sports setting, where someone describes a game mishap.

events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with one male speaker remarking that someone is "certainly going to learn how to adapt to the situation." He describes this person as "on the job trainer right now". Then, another male speaker continues about how someone respected another person when MJ was 38 and playing for the Washington Wizards. He said MJ would go at Kevin Garnett, who was not the same MJ. A single speaker is heard throughout. The audio has a conversational and informative tone with no background music or ambiance present.

events_list.video_caption: The video captures an intense basketball game between the Minnesota Timberwolves and the Washington Wizards. The scoreboard shows the Timberwolves leading 55 to 42 with 2:21 remaining in the second quarter. Players in black and white jerseys are actively engaged in the game, with the Timberwolves in possession of the ball. The court features the Timberwolves' logo, and the arena is filled with spectators. The game progresses with the Timberwolves advancing the ball towards the basket, attempting a shot that is contested by the Wizards' defense. The scoreboard updates to show the Wizards have narrowed the gap to 48 points with 1:10 remaining in the second quarter. The Timberwolves continue to push for a score, with players making strategic moves and the crowd watching intently. The video also includes a brief shot of a different game, featuring players in red and white jerseys, with the scoreboard showing the Bulls leading 13-10. The atmosphere is charged with excitement as the Timberwolves strive to maintain their lead.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip starts with a male speaker discussing Michael Jordan taking it upon himself to work against Kevin Garnett, even noting that he looked like "a prime version of MJ" despite being a Washington Wizards player. His tone is conversational and analytical. The speech then shifts to discuss MJ's respect for KG and his desire for a challenge, implying MJ went hard on Garnett due to his killer mentality, showcasing it at that particular time.
